TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: Oh, that is strange.  Maybe I don't get to see my own gamercard then. Thanks for the heads up.

> 
> 
> 14 hours ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Hmm, what do you mean? It looks fine to me.
> 

Ok, sorry for the double post. I had my lady check on her desktop and its not showing up on hers either. Does forum sigs need approval from mods? Maybe thats why you're able to see it.

> 
> 
> 3 minutes ago, Kerbal-Willie said:
> 
> 
> Does forum sigs need approval from mods?
> 

No, they don't (though they do need to follow the forum rules).

Have you checked your settings? If you go to [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/settings/signature/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/settings/signature/) the slider at the top should be green and have a checkmark.

> 
> 
> 2 minutes ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Have you checked your settings? If you go to [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/settings/signature/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/settings/signature/) the slider at the top should be green and have a checkmark.
> 

Yes, sigs are enabled. I do also see other members sigs. I will play around some more with it, Maybe I have it too large or its jut too ugly and forums are like, no sir.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, Kerbal-Willie said:
> 
> 
> Yes, sigs are enabled. I do also see other members sigs. I will play around some more with it, Maybe I have it too large or its jut too ugly and forums are like, no sir.
> 

Are you on mobile?

> 
> 
> 5 minutes ago, Dman979 said:
> 
> 
> Are you on mobile?
> 

No, i'm on the PS4 browser. Which I guess is derived from a mobile browser. And maybe my girlfriend didn't have sigs enabled when she checked on PC or, sigs areturned off by default for guests? Either way I feel silly wasting your time on something so trivial. 

It's just strange I see everyone elses sigs on this browser.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-24T22:26:11Z" title="04/24/2017 10:26  PM" data-short="7 yr">April 24, 2017</time> by Kerbal-Willie**

> 
> 
> Just now, Kerbal-Willie said:
> 
> 
> No, i'm on the PS4 browser.
> 

That might be part of it. Try logging in on a PC or Mac.

> 
> 
> Just now, Kerbal-Willie said:
> 
> 
> And maybe my girlfriend didn't have sigs enabled when she checked on PC or, sigs are turned off by default for guests?
> 

Signatures are turned off by default for guests.

> 
> 
> Just now, Kerbal-Willie said:
> 
> 
> Either way I feel silly wasting your time on something so trivial.
> 

I'm happy to help! Besides, it's on-topic. I once asked what time of day the most users were online.

Solved, thank you @**[Dman979](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123837-dman979/ "Go to Dman979's profile")**  **for your patience** **.** There are some sigs I am able to view with the PS4 browser like yours and the steam card ones and others I can not like exophase gamercards.

So this thread has been moved from every single fourm. Why is that? 

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/31830-dont-click-this/&page=1&do=embed"></iframe>
Silliness. Pay it no mind.

I came here to ask about that thread! Is it actually being locked then unlocked, or never locked at all? If I ask on that thread [@Dman979](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123837-dman979/) will accuse me of violating Rule 3.3.

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, Brent Kerman said:
> 
> 
> I came here to ask about that thread! Is it actually being locked then unlocked, or never locked at all? If I ask on that thread [@Dman979](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/123837-dman979/) will accuse me of violating Rule 3.3.
> 

It was a joke thread, much like 'ban the user above you' and is why it was in forum games. It has now been locked.

Is there a discussion thread about this?

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/159902-its-looking-like-a-moderators-account-has-been-compromised/&do=embed"></iframe>

> 
> 
> 17 minutes ago, Rath said:
> 
> 
> Is there a discussion thread about this?
> 
> 
> <iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/159902-its-looking-like-a-moderators-account-has-been-compromised/&do=embed"></iframe>
> 

No. The moderator in question has already received enough abusive remarks, we don't want to discuss the details lest we give anyone else ideas how to cause trouble, and there's already been some wild speculation which hasn't helped the situation.

>

> 37 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> No. The moderator in question has already received enough abusive remarks, we don't want to discuss the details lest we give anyone else ideas how to cause trouble, and there's already been some wild speculation which hasn't helped the situation.
> 

Thanks.
There used to be an "ignore user" button, where did it go?

Top right of the screen, click on your username, Ignored users, and add their name there.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/ignore/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/ignore/)
I have been on the fourms for about 40 minutes and I was logged out 3 or 4 times. Is/was it just a random bug? It was on my iPhone and when I went to another sub fourm, I was logged off.

I got off the fourm and made sure that the remember me box was checked and I was just logged out when I came back.

Is reporting your own posts in order to get the attention of the moderation team when you don't know which moderators are most applicable irritating?
Most issues do not require the use of the report function. If time is not a factor, you could ping or PM one of us.
